Let me start by saying that this is, by far, the most excited I’ve been about a new social network since Instagram first entered the ring. But, in my couple days of usage, I’ve began to notice one thing that really stands out as being a bit annoying: lack of speaker indication. When rooms have a healthy amount of people on the stage, you find yourself playing a game of hide & seek as you tediously scroll to find who’s avatar has the ring. So here’s my 2 possible suggestions & wishes:

1) As they already have for “Followed by Speakers”, make a “Moderators” section at the top of the room and a “Stage” section below it. Then make it to where speaker notifications (“___ is speaking” as a drop down notification) are exclusive to when a moderator is speaking. This way, the amount of scrolling to find who is talking would be reduced to on stage participants only. And the audience will be alerted when a moderator is speaking.

2) Decrease the profile sizes of those on stage as the number increases so that more avatars can fit on the screen. That way, when someone is speaking, we can see who it is without scrolling as much.|Who is Talking?|Jacket Coatman|5|False|2021-01-07 14:56:34|

People want this app public and I believe you guys can continue to work on the app while doing so. It’s just not the same

Listennnnn!! This app is the “stage” I said I would stand on and speak to the masses. 2020 said ok the stage is virtual babygurl but you gon’ be just as profound because now ya don’t hafta worry about hair and makeup! Just speak!
This app revives the art of verbal communication like the good ol’ days when you had a 30 ft house phone cord so you could kick up your feet and chat with your friends about your goals! Just what we need during this pandemic to keep hearts, minds and spirits LIFTED!
When you are intentional with your connections and your message, this app brings your tribe to you! Results NOT rhetoric with the genuine interactions! Keep a notepad, sticky notes, SOMETHING because the jewels being dropped on a daily will blow your mind and shift your life!
And thus ends my dissertation on Clubhouse:  The juxtaposition of social distancing and verbally embracing✊🏾

Before joining Clubhouse, I was unclear on what the application would truly offer beyond being yet another social media platform. After joining Clubhouse I became aware of both how misguided I was about Clubhouse and how much as a new small business owner I needed this forum.

The connections I’ve made have been various but all have been invaluable. I’ve received what can arguably be tens of thousands of dollars worth of free advice about everything from branding to best business practices. The potential business collaborations are unfolding but I believe that they will be mutually beneficial.

I think the big challenge for Clubhouse going forward is to not try to be a platform for all people and all things. I’ve seen some of the rooms take on the postures and topics that are more “traphouse” than Clubhouse. I am not advocating classism but I think that perhaps making “hallways” for certain types of rooms may be interesting (but this may create echo chambers that would be counter Clubhouse).|The Best Social Media Platform For Building Your Business|Ikigai Guy|5|False|2021-02-18 21:17:43|

The app requires your phone number (first red flag), then it requires your contacts (the list of which it keeps forever, for all we know - second red flag). So anyone who has ever had your phone number not only can see your profile, but also share it with anyone or any room without your consent (a giant red flag - at the time of writing there's no way to selectively restrict your profile to certain users). Which makes Clubhouse a superspreader feeding ground for stalkers.
Currently there's no way to simply delete your account, you can only request its removal and wait until someone attends to it - another red flag, that points at data collection, likely to sell it to third parties. At the time of writing Clubhouse "temporarily" stores voice recordings on their servers, which is a complete U-turn from their initial promises during the release. Some of the data the app collects from your phone has nothing to do with the service it provides - yet another red flag, and yet another app that treats its users as a product.
On top of that, despite the app being in its early days, there's little to no moderation of hateful and toxic content, making it easy to exploit for people spreading dangerous conspiracies.|Zero respect for privacy. Red flags all over.|valhakun|1|False|2021-02-17 22:13:16|

I loved loved loved the app until today. Before the update, I got to jump in and out of very diverse chats, from finance to music to psychology to poetry to straight up gossip chatrooms. After the update; my listening is very limited to the people I chose to follow and their interest in the two weeks I’ve been on the app.

Clubhouse has turned itself into another Instagram app where it shows you targeted content based off of the content you “liked” when you first joined. I HATE IT HERE NOW.

What made the app great for me was I had access every space, every topic, everyone everywhere (within the app, of course) with just a click on a globe. Now I have to scroll thru people I follow to find other people to follow in hopes the start an interesting room when in reality they are avid listeners and note takers like myself.

Since you removed the explorer page, I can’t expand my knowledge or explore other topics I may not have known existed. Since I didn’t follow enough people early on, I lost access to many spaces including psychological and finance chats which is directly within my field. 

 So now with such a heavy heart, I dislike the app because I’m stuck listening to the same people talking about the same things every other day. 

Can y’all bring back the explorer page?! Please and thank you. 

If not; I’ll stick to Twitter b|c there I can at least click on a thread within the thread and learn something new.|Great app but unfortunately it’s limited now.|Ensu F.|5|False|2020-11-17 13:52:47|

column1:
So I definitely found my crowd of ppl and it’s awesome and heartwarming. I can network if I so choose or just explore different rooms with my interest. Definitely five stars. I can’t wait to see how the app is improved over time. Here are some of my suggestions:
▪️A clapping or heart emoji when someone says something that resonates. And everyone can see the reactions of each other or maybe just the speaker. 
▪️A brighter color highlighting the speaker(s) and maybe if their icon became bigger so when you want to address someone it will be easier to find them when scrolling through the room. Design feature idea: what if the stage icons were set in a circle with the speaker in the middle. Idk. Just putting that out there. 
▪️Maybe a raised hand feature when on stage to speak next. Sometimes ppl talk over each other and while mostly everyone is polite about it we forget who should speak next. Maybe a number system! for example when I am done speaking whoever raising their hand on stage after me gets the number 1, 2, 3 and so on, on their icon and they get to go next. 

All in all I love the app and it helps greatly in these times. Some ppl are getting jobs, it’s helping small business, ppl are doing interviews and find their safe spaces to express themselves. Excellent work to the team. Love and light.|Love this app|celihere|5|False|2021-01-17 18:49:07|

But I love clubhouse.  It gives you access to talks with high level people.  It actually provides value in your life.  

To the dev team, some user notes:

I have notifications enabled but banners on IOS don’t give me good information.  I get a partial list of people in a room, but the banner runs out of space before I see what the room is.  A better format would be “[room name]: on stage is [people names]”.  As they are now, the notifications are basically useless. 

On the scheduled rooms up at the top of the feed, it would be good to be able to schedule myself to listen in on the room, instead of having to remember to go back and find it again.  Then get a notification that the selected room is beginning.  

It would be good to be able to subscribe to recurring rooms, in addition to following users.  When someone creates a room, they might have the option to “make recurring” and then select which recurring room it falls into.  This would allow for unique room titles, but also allow listeners to never miss a weekly/daily room they love. 

Finally, I’d say to add an estimated duration function.  When someone starts a room, they put in the expected length of the discussion so that listeners can plan their time.|I hate social media|Brosef Josef|5|False|2021-02-26 16:15:05|

column1:
I absolutely love this app so far. It has such a great and eclectic mix of people (especially POC) from a breadth of backgrounds; the conversations I’ve joined and listened to have been genuinely interesting, at all hours; and I like the range of topics. 

It’s quickly becoming my favorite social platform — and, yes, it is addictive. 

But I definitely echo some of the other reviews. It would be great to explore topics I didn’t pre-select during sign-up, just to see what else is out there. Being able to at least ‘react’ to conversations would be nice (even with an emoji to show appreciation). I found out about this app from an article in August or so  of 2020 and immediately looked it up to download. I found out it was invite only and since it was relatively new still I decided to sign up, thinking it wouldn’t be that long since I got in early.  Half a year later I’m still waiting for my invite text, but that’s not the best part. 

I live in Shanghai and the Chinese community has recently found out about this app because of a little chat Elon musk had with RobinHood. So it’s gotten quite large over here. So I’m seeing the people that have been able to sign up has spiked because now most of my Chinese friends ( who has no idea about this app two days ago ) have accounts except me, someone who has been waiting for ,what feels like , forever. 

I understand that it’s mostly my FOMO that has me upset but I don’t understand that, just because one irrelevant person got into the group that now I have other friends who are asking me what this app is, have accounts, and I don’t when i was really excited to join this community from the ground floor and discuss really awesome cross culture issues . Now I feel like I’m missing all of the good stuff already. 

So shouldn’t people who are actually interested in joining be allowed to join first before people who are just joining because their friends tell them to?|Basis of joining?|Aaahlex|1|False|2021-02-08 10:43:35|

I’ve really enjoyed the communities on Clubhouse, but the actual experience of using the app is bad. The audio quality is terrible—the levels of every speaker vary widely, and often change dramatically within any given session. Also the fact that you can’t hear yourself when speaking is a major problem. For an app whose sole focus is audio this is unacceptable.

The ability to communicate other than actually speaking is nonexistent. It would be helpful to add some additional messaging options. And the notification options are also poor. There should be better filters to help promote rooms you only care about. The current settings don’t work well at all.  

Overall, there’s a lot of potential with this app, but it needs much work, particularly with the awful audio.|Great community
column2: bad app|Milty_sug|3|False|2021-03-15 08:38:27|

Well, the app was great and brought much fun for the first few times I used it.
But after two weeks usage, I was frustrated that I can’t train the recommender algorithm at all, and my recommendation list was always stuck with rooms I’m not interested in. For example, I didn’t check the Russian language as my interest, but yesterday, half of rooms on my list are Russian rooms. And I know my friend’s friends are hosting some interesting topics there but I can never see them on my recommendation list. Even if I have got the link to a specific room, I can only add them on the Apple or Google calendar but not the clubhouse calendar.
 I enjoyed the app but I really have a big doubt about your algorithm. So, I gave a negative review, and hopefully this issue could be solved.|Bad UX because of the weird recommender system|Vivia Chao|1|False|2021-02-21 03:45:30|

Do we really miss the noise of chatter in the background of our lives that much? If I want high quality audio content then Podcasts and Audiobooks would provide me a wider variety, along with reviews and ratings. If I want social content from random people, we have enough of that on so many different social media platforms... where we don’t have to take turns to speak , waiting for a moderator to put us on the spot. If I want social interactions with close friends, how about also adding video in a video chat?

There is delight in the radio like experience of randomness in what you find while you scan the radio frequencies, and there is nostalgia in the noise of chatter. So 2 stars not 1.|A fad that is delightful but useless|Blissful and weightless|2|False|2021-02-12 07:25:12|

A friend gave me an invite so I tried it. My impression is that it’s very, very slimy. The “art” community is filled with “venture capitalists”. The “meditation” community is filled with fashion brands and someone who who claims to have $100m in startup money. Self proclaimed experts in mental health lead to Twitter feeds where they are pitching Netflix shows. 

The entire community is like scooping the bottom of the social media barrel of hustle culture, self promotion, and snake oil salesman. Imagine all the rejects from TED talks combined with Twitch and you get the idea. It’s super gross and I deleted my account. I can only imagine the business model behind this, probably hoping to scrape your data to sell to third parties as usual for Silicon Valley. The first thing it asked was access to my contacts, which is data scraping 101. No thanks!!!!|Bad|mchuman|1|False|2021-02-15 21:43:55|

column1:
You must use your phone number to set up the app. It then asks for access to your personal contacts and every time you log in it shows you the photos/profiles of every single contact you have in your phone who is on Clubhouse. It’s disturbing to me that my photo and profile are shown to every person who has ever had my number saved in their phone. 

A big red flag is that you are unable to delete your profile in the app or on their website. You must first confirm your e-mail address in the app, then e-mail them and request deletion. They have stated they will take a long time to respond via e-mail. 

Clubhouse is so invasive it is not worth downloading.|Invasive App When it Comes to Privacy/Personal Safety|loveisaboombox|1|False|2021-01-24 03:04:18|

It’s a great platform that allows thoughts and ideas to be discussed while the audio humanizes those behind the screen name...even through there are trolls, they are limited because they can’t get away with just creating a bunch of anonymous accounts.

Issues:
1.) it’s not clear up front that whoever you accept an invite from lives on your profile permanently. That may not seem like an issue to most but it can create a privacy issue for some AND...

2.) you cannot delete your own account. I’ve tried to email their only customer service email daily for the past 2 weeks and they simply do not respond. It’s infuriating.

3.) reporting incidents: I’m not sure how you don’t record conversations and then enforce penalties - ie suspension and permanent ban (founders words) because they can’t review anything. Sounds like if anyone reports an account, they will take action without proof.  Cancel culture will kill this app based on this alone.|Great idea

column1:
While this app is fun, it won’t let you invite anyone unless you share your contacts list. Then, it can only be shared with someone in your contacts. 

But what’s really bad is that Clubhouse, without disclosing this in their privacy policy, keeps a copy of all your contacts and then uses it! There appears to be no way to have your contacts removed from their server as I continue receiving notifications about contacts who sign up even though I have since revoked access to my contacts. 

I’ve asked the company multiple times what they’re doing with my contacts, why they’re keeping copies on their server, and to delete my contacts. But they won’t respond.|Beware privacy invasion!|Daniel J. Lewis|1|False|2021-01-29 21:53:11|

I downloaded this after getting an invite.  For the first day or two I learned what it was and how to use it. Pretty easy and I was on board.  Now after. 2 weeks on the platform, here’s my honest and transparent feedback. 

1. The forums and topics are somewhat interesting until you actually get in them. You’ll find folks go off topic and the convo evolves into a much different topic and convo than was originally stated. Some moderators bring it back to center snd stay on point. Most do not. 

2. Moderators usually invite their fellow friends to talk about topics. The same people seem to be in the same topics so it gets to be redundant...fast. I like others povs but these moderators not to invite new folks to speak and share. This turned me off completely. And YES, I could of started my own topic and chat to curb all this but I got turned off by the app before I even cared to do that. 

Net net, it’s fine. I’m super bored of it after 2 weeks which isn’t a good sign. My friends also share the same sentiment. 

Great concept. A solid meh experience and that’s being kind.|What’s all the hype?|Thinos|1|False|2021-01-25 23:05:51|

column1:
That’s basically what this app is. 
If you enjoy audio chatter/discussions with random people this might be fun. 
I get the appeal of the group chat without the need to worry about camera appearance. Usually I can also just not turn on my camera. 
Dunno. Feels flat to me plus audio only without the chat boxes means I can’t pick up and go, it needs to be intentionally scheduled time to sit down and listen in / participate. 
Can’t really use this while watching a show, let’s say. Or read a chapter in a book and swap to this. 
If you really like talking to people, or listening to random people talk about stuff, this might be for you. Matter of taste I suppose.|Audio only interactive podcasts|Roman3737|3|False|2021-02-15 16:32:18|

column1:
There’s no good reason Clubhouse needs full contact list access to invite others. It seems like a way to harvest 100s of millions of phone numbers. That’s going to end up with more robocalls for everyone. 

I have made social mobile apps before and it’s easy to safely invite others using apple and google’s frameworks without giving up you whole contact list. 

If clubhouse gets hacked or they sell their database, someone is going to get over 500 million phone numbers. This is a recipe for disaster and should be stopped immediately. (6 million users * 150 contacts per user - duplicates = ~500 million contacts total)

The contact list notification box doesn’t follow apple’s privacy guidelines.|Why Contact list access?|kishx|1|False|2021-02-09 16:06:59|

column1:
I haven’t used social media apps consistently much this year because I’ve honestly just become bored with them, but this app is different. Instead of feeling like your wasting time when you could be doing something more productive you’re actually gaining knowledge, making new friends, networking, and starting life changing relationships. Another plus is that you can meet people without the worry that they’re really just bots or dealing with the image obsessed culture of other social media apps that force you to post cumbersome videos & pictures that just brainwashes society into thinking that beauty is the most important defining trait of a human beings value. Rather than far better traits like knowledge, hard work, and actual social relationships. Apps like Instagram, Twitter and Tik Tok don’t have real social relationships they have “follow relationships” and it’s wonderful to finally see an app that’s finally reversing the pathetic trends social media companies have introduced into how we think about real human interactions. 
The one recommendation I would give to the developers is to add a functioning search feature, the app only lets you see chat rooms it’s AI search ranking system thinks you’ll be interested in. Unfortunately in my case this AI tends to be wrong more often than not. Beside that thank you to the people who created this amazing app, in a year where people are more isolated than ever before this app is finally doing something to bring people together.|Best social media app in my life|Ify101|5|False|2020-12-30 03:58:22|

column1: While the app is novel it’s weird you can’t rewind a little bit in case you happen to miss something. I know it’s a live format platform but the be able to even skip back 30 seconds that would be enough. A background chat feature would be helpful if you prefer to ask questions and have them be addressed without being forced to speak. Better curation and (blocking) of certain clubs. My fee is constantly bloated very irrelevant clubs that have nothing to do with my interests. Seems fairly unintelligent. Plus I also see clubs in different languages such as Chinese
column2: Russian
column3: or some other Asian based language. Totally fine for people who read (and speak) this language but I only speak English and I makes no sense that Im not able to filter and limit these from showing in my feed. For some reason the Instagram account link page does not work. I log in with Facebook and it never works. I also wish these was a way to hide the person that “nominated” you. It’s kinda weird that you are forced to display this info on your profile without the option to hide it. Finally
column4: the app icon literally makes no sense and doesn’t visually capture the branding of the actual app. Why is there some random dudes head in the icon?? Who is he?? My 5-minute Clubhouse Analysis 😍

What is it: borderless meeting (of the minds) platform for people with LIKE-interests, called "clubs".

UX-talk:  whoever is speaking is not well highlighted. bigger/ bolder color callout colors that pulsates or enlarge speaker icon. Frustratingly, the visuals are unappealing but the content is king. New alerts have no audio alerts, in an audio only platform, don't expect people to visually pay attention.

#1 feature which I think is pretty critical is whenever you're mid conversation/ thought and you hear a golden nugget that you want to replay AND you can't! 😡

🌟Feature requests

1| Playback last 15 secs tappable x3  +  live button 

2| English only filter on alerts for "English" conversations only

3| Visual timeline of where you are in the conversation: beginning, middle, end... We don't live in an endless realm of space time continuum without responsibilities, help us plan our schedules accordingly. I sat in a four hour chat when i thought multiple times it is ending soon

4| Bookmarks (metrics): hot clubs have large audiences and there's no engagement metric of which part of a conversation listeners find are "of value". Allow for bookmarks that allows users to pick keynotes of the convo. This also allows for feedback back to host on what was valuable vs not. Maybe even go further and allow a 'golden mic' reward metric to measure engaged Hosts.

My App Review: 

🙌wow, linkedin missed out. facebook missed out. These guys are geniuses. This is the platform that gets people together. Consider it the professional / hobby /enthusiast platform, similar to FB groups. Content.... is king here. When you hop into a room that resonates, it is addictive. Think podcasts meets paid specialty webinars for FREE.

The way content is consumed, it doesn't matter whether its going to be true or not anymore, probably less wiki and more time spent on "host" influencers. Still not sure how they’re going to monetize, maybe eventually freemium model, supported by selling your interests/ data?? for now, who cares. 

Highly recommend using the app. Hope they grow.|Excellent content. App needs work though! ** feature requests!!|tekraid|4|False|2021-03-09 15:43:16|

First, I love this app and I highly recommend it because wow is it packed with information. I love how easily we can connect these knowledgeable people, celebs included. So many people are active, yet it feels like I’m really in...a clubhouse! Especially since it’s the beta version. What was promised is delivered. While I’ve not yet gotten involved in a room right as it began, whenever I do pop in, I always feel like I can get right into the tips—especially from the celebrity guests. 
—The background play?? NICE. I can swipe through any profile, even go to different social media platforms within the app and still listen. It’s very easy to tap around and not feel like I’ve messed something up. 
—Love that we can search for anybody in the room or invite people. 

***LET’S GET INTO CONS***
—10 notifications an hour?? Why?? And they’re just bricks of names. Super annoying and uninviting. Maybe if I’m a *new* account you can send notifications in a similar fashion, so I can see the names I might like. However, 10 notifs is crazy. Especially if you don’t put the name of the room I’m heading into FIRST and in BOLD WITH EMOJIS. 👁
—Once I start following people and I turn on post notifications, wherever they will be, I should be notified with a buzzing notification. I appreciate that the other notifications are silent, but (next point) 🗣
—I now follow about 150 people. I don’t know which room nor do I have the desire to read through a list of names to see where those people will be. Take note from IG. Add a “following” page and show me what rooms those I follow are currently involved in/what they have coming up (with the option to tap a notification bell for that specific room, of course). Again, make sure the name of the room is first and in BOLD. You can feature names in the within that post—in
Bold if I follow them. Beneath the heading, and allow me the option to tap on the post to see a list of hyperlinked names of the moderators/speakers. Make sure those who I have post notifs turned on for are FIRST. 📌 
—Can you have a feature where you save the session for 24 hours or is it just for live viewers?
—Can the rooms be regulated? One mod said something like, “we’ve been hosting for over 10 hours! 😄” I don’t know if she meant that the one room had been going on for that long or what, but it would be nice to get a sense of not only what I’ll be listening to, but for how long it goes on. 
—Please add an applause feature, and a hand-raising feature for the speakers. Maybe add a feature where we can gift things app-only gifts to members. Like badges? Maybe I’m getting ahead of myself there. 🏅 
—When the speakers want to add something, make their circles squares or stars or something and change the color so I can see them. 
—Make it clearer what section I’m looking at. Have drop-down menus showing me where the audience is, the mods, etc. 📃 
—Add a chat feature, maybe. I’d love to be able to ask people in a chat room about what the person just said. But I don’t see a chat feature at any time. A chat feature could always start out open at the bottom half of the screen with an option to close it. Everyone would have the option to use the chat, except the speakers and mods have names in bold, badges, custom lettering, etc. As well, give the option to tap the name of an audience member’s chat to @ and respond to them. Then again, this feature could backfire. Idk. 🤔
—The speakers say to DM them, but should we not be allowed to DM them here? I understand it could be exhausting trying to answer DMs from a bunch of platforms, but how do we directly contact them as clubhouse members as opposed to just “fans”?
—The layout makes me dizzy.🤢 It just feels like a bunch of stuff everywhere. No clear lines of demarcation. 
—Maybe utilize “flyers” that are more visual rather than always a wall of text to call attention to upcoming rooms. 

That’s all for now. Thank you guys for creating/hosting such an innovative club! 😄|10 Notifications Per Hour??|bilambilam|3|False|2021-02-28 22:42:44|

Clubhouse is an intellectual aural SPA! 

Never in my life would I expect to be listening to people I don’t know speaking about issues or topics I am passionate about from all over the world, varying levels of awareness and expertise or political persuasions. 

It is incredibly addictive in the best way possible because you are intoxicated with listening to people being FULLY human. 

YOU can HEAR their pain, passion and everything in between. Instead of people hiding behind fashion choices, fabulous backgrounds or makeup trends, you get to FOCUS on the what makes people unique- their point of view. You can SEE through viewpoint as they explain why they feel the way they do or how they came to a certain conclusion.  

The iPhone is the optimal device to be able to listen to different tones, pitch, timber, etc due to it’s superior audio quality, hence why reality shows always use iPhone for speakerphone scenes. And this is crucial to literally BE with other people.. hearing their full humanity projected over wifi. People are raw, honest and yet somehow respectful. You can HEAR people pausing, gasping, crying, laughing, thinking, searching for words or the meaning of life.. all in REAL time. And we have the opportunity to LISTEN. 

Unfortunately, The ISSUE is RACE. While Clubhouse aims to be and remain a safe space for everyone, some feel as though Black people are not welcomed, and some of the statements made by some users are dismissive and indicate a level of awareness that should have been achieve post #GeorgeFloyd 

So there needs to be more of a balance regarding creating a safe space and tools for moderators to ensure people are not traumatized or triggered while using the app. It’s a glorious, life changing and addictive odyssey, but with all things human- is isn’t perfect. I’m willing to dive DEEP into the issues and create solutions on “room” on clubhouse filled with curious, open, respectful, mindful, well intended people at a time.|BLOVING CLUBHOUSE! But there are ISSUES around race and diversity|kanene h|4|False|2020-10-27 17:55:46|

Go check your Apple privacy settings on this app...there’s no way to decide how they use your microphone. 

Just a few days ago Clubhouse gave me the option to turn off my microphone via Apple’s privacy settings. It didn’t give me the option to allow microphone usage only when in app, so I decided to only turn on the microphone when I wanted to talk.

That being said, I noticed today that there is no option to choose microphone settings anymore. One is locked in and does not have option to choose how the app uses one’s microphone. 

Users need the option to decide when the microphone is being used. Yes sure, a lot of people are signing up now and may overlook this feature, because this is a voice chat app, but it is questionable that there are no options to change the microphone settings to allow only in-app, or to set them at all.

It’s becoming easier to jump in on this platform, so it can be easy to overlook this stuff with all the hype of getting in. Giving permission for someone to have your address book feels like a small price to pay in order to “let more people in,” but a  in practice. It’s already questionable how the idea of exclusivity makes the possibility of joining more elusive and exciting...I’ve definitely fallen for it. 

I really want to be able to use this app- feels like a cool way to connect with folks. Please give us the option to change the settings. 

People are excited to get in, but let’s chill out and not download the app until Clubhouse is transparent and committed to allowing users to customize the microphone settings.|Questionable microphone privacy...alarming|Lils777|1|False|2021-03-13 22:33:28|

The ability to connect with people from all over the world - amazing
The ability to connect on a wide variety of topics - amazing
The lack of real support beyond an FAQ or possibility being called on in a scheduled townhall - heartless

How is there nor even a contact us form anywhere on the site?

You can have the most amazing car, but if a minor fender bender puts your life at risk, no longer so amazing.

Upon opening the app today it was as if the app had never been opened before, asked me my name and for a new username  🤔
Upon then getting in my olde profile was there with Picture and creator name and so I tapped the new user name so I could change it back to the original but it says you can only change it once.....I NEVER SELECTED AN OPTION TO CHANGE USER NAME the app prompted my at startup to create a new account.  It always logged right into my account b4.....

Searched the website, FAQ no answers and your Twitter account doesn’t allow for message contact.....so y’all left me on an island with out a solution to a glitchy app....and I’ve lost my identity 😪

column1:
Besides music, I don’t do much audio but Clubhouse is something I’m definitely starting to enjoy. It may take a while to find which clubs and rooms that interest you, depending on what you like. I highly recommend giving it a try!

The only things I would recommend that they add to the app is an option to view a Club’s calendar while on the club page. When viewing the “Upcoming Events” on the main calendar page, you’re likely to see dozens of events. Sometimes I just want to see upcoming events for a particular club. 

Also, while in a live room it can be difficult to see which member is speaking. Maybe they can change that highlighted gray border of the speaker to a more noticeable color or shade border. (03.13.2021)|I’m Warming Up to It 😊|Studio_R|4|False|2021-03-13 18:34:39|

column1:
This is literally the best app I’ve ever had the privilege to use in my entire life.

It’s all audio and human connection. The developers show up every single week to make sure to get feedback from the users and are continuously making improvements.

The best part is how they have their no policy trolls, bully, overall mean people set up. This is invite only so who ever invite someone to the app is also responsible for that person, meaning,If someone is being a bully, troll were using hate speech then they are reported and if the developer said that they are banned from this app as well as the person who gave them the invite.

And guess what, invites are earned by how much you give to the app and the communities there.

People are showing up who are brilliant brilliant human beings that we literally get to have conversations with.

Imagine having access to a speaking engagement for free from your home with some of the greatest minds out there and the ability to ask them questions for free.

This app is for people who give their time and don’t ask for anything in return because they want to collectively serve the community as a human race.

This app has restored my faith in humanity as I can hear and connect with people that are athletic and genuine.

Are there opportunities for fun? Comedy? Shark Tank pitch rooms? Finding Capital and being an angel investor account? Discussing mental health topics? Support for mothers, men, couples, Artist, physicians, dentists, coaches, speakers, Podcasters, music engineer, music artist, yes. That is what I haveAt the top of my mind.

Could this be great for business opportunities? Absolutely, but of course if you know so good and marketers ruin everything LOL but there is a classy way to do things after you’ve net worth and connecting with people.

If you have an iPhone download this app and hopefully your friend in your contact list and you can see for yourself.

And because I’m here Typing out this review, I might as well let you all know that you can find my clubs “self care curators”  and “ conscious couples quote from JennyAHansen.

If you find me from this review please message me and let me know because that would add a whole new level of cool to this entire community and apps abilities.

Lots of love! Have a beautiful and amazing day.

JennyAHansen|"The BEST App | A beautiful need for people now"|JennyAHansen|5|False|2021-03-09 22:57:55|

column1: Clubhouse is straight forward and very interesting. In many ways it reminds me of an old platform from the 90s called Paltalk. The difference is that this is audio only and it’s really a network building tool.Another cool aspect is the fact that it’s invite only. This kind of puts you in a space of responsibility for the people that you invite. Which means
column2: at least I hope
column3: that there won’t be many trolls on this platform. My only challenge is that I’ve been on for about four days now and in a group for new users
column4: they say we can create our own clubs and suggested we should do so within our first seven days. They explained that there was a new update that allowed for us to create a new club and that we could use it by going down to the clubs that were a member of and clicking the plus symbol and then proceeding to create that new club. There was an issue with that and one member was told that they should uninstall the app and then reinstall it and that should get them the most recent update which was yesterday. I did that exact thing
column5: and found that high am not able to make a club. The messaging states that I have to be one of the top users to make a club. So that was disappointing. I can
column6: however
column7: create a room. I think the rooms you create disappear when you leave them. I am excited to learn more and would definitely give 5 stars if I could make a club.|Definitely Worth Exploring|DaisyRo8|4|False|2021-03-06 16:38:38|

column1: I am liking the app so far and I definitely enjoy the conversations I’ve had. I see the potential that this app has for connecting people. I’d love to send an invite to another friend who could use it but I don’t have any more. It would have been helpful for the app to give me a heads up or even for the invite to bounce back or something. Also
